info.title: Iko.travel
info.description:
# Extranet API
Welcome to the Extranet API - A programmer-friendly way to manage your travel inventory on the iko.travel platform. This API offers a superset of the features you can find at [https://extranet.iko.travel](https://extranet.iko.travel) and gives you all the tools you need to ready your properties and inventory for sale across 10000s of our unique sales channels.
What differentiates us from existing Extranets is 1. we make it available for everyone to use and 2. the care we take in only working with properties that have quality, curated content and ways to upsell and cross sell customers with ancillary products and experiences. Content creators have the ability to make their inventory look great and be searchable in a wide variety of ways. You won't find properties with generic inventory, low resolution pictures and little ancillary content that can easily be found everywhere else on the internet.
# Integrations
We have already integrated with the most well-known channel managers so you don't have to. Once your properties are set up, you can finish the setup by mapping your property to iko.travel using your channel manager partner portal. If your properties don't have a channel manager, you can easily manage rates and availability with this API.
- Allotz
- CloudBeds / MyAllocator
- Comanche
- d-edge
- FastBooking
- HotelLink
- HoteliersGuru
- Omnibees
- RateGain
- Rate Tiger
- ResAvenue
- Siteminder
- Travelclick
- Yieldplanet
# Usage
These features are made available to you via a [REST API](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer). This API is language agnostic. We will link to SDKs for the most popular programming languages on this page as they become available.
## Versioning
We chose to version our endpoints in a way that we hope affects your integration with us the least. You request the version of our API you wish to work with via the `Accept Header` and by using our custom JSON mime type. When it's time for you to upgrade, you only have to change the version number to get access to our updated endpoints. Example: application/vnd.platform-v`1`+json.
## Release history
- 20201-07-01: v1 - Initial release
# Intended Audience
Programmers are [most likely] a requirement to start integrating with iko.travel. Companies and organizations that would most benefit from integrating with us are new and existing travel companies that have relationships with suppliers and that need an advanced system from which to manage their travel inventory and get that same inventory out to as many eyeballs as possible at the lowest price possible.
- Hotel chains
- Hotel brands
- Travel tech companies
- Destination sites
- Integrators
- Aggregators
- Destination management companies
- Travel agencies
- OTAs
If you are looking to sell existing inventory and create bookings and earn a commission, head over to our [Affiliate API](/docs?api=affiliate).
# Authentication
OAuth2

tags.name: Channels
tags.description: Channels are top-level sales channels available to the property. A property can choose to disable a top-level channel or apply a discount, commission and promotions to a top-level channel and it will get applied to all segments and accounts that derive from this channel.

tags.name: Rate Plan
tags.description: Rate plans restrict the availability of travel inventory. You can apply rate plans to master rates, packages and add-ons to better control how you want to make this inventory available for sale.

tags.name: Track
tags.description: Track user views across your properties and more.

tags.name: Media
tags.description: Manage property media including images and videos. Property media are for general pictures of the hotel such as main featured image, around premises, lobby etc. For all other media, each travel inventory section contains its own section for managing media.

tags.name: Currency
tags.description: Currency API

tags.name: Daily Rate
tags.description: Manage daily rates and availability for your master rates using these endpoints.

tags.name: CalDAV
tags.description: The CalDav API let's you link your favorite calendar software with the iko.travel platform and lets you see all your bookings from your calendar.

tags.name: Inventory
tags.description: Inventory API

tags.name: Country
tags.description: Country API

tags.name: Social Network
tags.description: Manage which social networks the property is connected to.

tags.name: Activity
tags.description: Activities are things travelers can do in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many sellable activities and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Green Index Questionnaire
tags.description: Green Index API

tags.name: Recognition
tags.description: A property can associate multiple types of third-party online / offline acknowledgements to their profile in the form of awards, reviews / ratings, articles and more.

tags.name: Onboarding
tags.description: This is the endpoint you will want to work first with to begin the process of onboarding your hotels onto the iko.travel platform.

tags.name: Master Rate
tags.description:
Master Rates are room types + rules and restrictions that get sold to and booked by travelers. A master rate consists simply of a guest room and a rate plan with the added ability to give away perks to travelers to incentivize them to book this master rate. 

Note: The platform works with rate plan-level availability. This means you assign the master rate availability and not the room type. You set initial availability on the room type / guest room, but you can override on the master rate level. This gives you more flexibility in how you want to sell your rooms. I.e. you can give more availability to a master rate than another with the same room but different rate plan. You can also overbook that room type.

tags.name: Policy
tags.description: Manage property policy such as whether the property allows children and pets.

tags.name: Meeting Room
tags.description: Manage meeting rooms that are on and off the premises. Make them viewable-only or let travelers book a meeting room together with their room.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Restaurants are eating establishments travelers can go to to get a meal in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many bookable restaurants and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Package
tags.description: Upsell travelers on packages. Creat value-added packages of anything you can think of and sell it with the room.

tags.name: Lifestyle
tags.description: Manage property lifestyles using this endpoint.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description: Manage important property contacts.

tags.name: Promotion
tags.description: Manage promotions and premiums and set complex rules for when you want to use them. A promotion can make the price go both up and down depending on how you want to use it.

tags.name: Calendar
tags.description: Manage reservation schedules for travel inventory such as meeting rooms, restaurants, spas, activities, attractions and places.

tags.name: Leaderboard
tags.description: See how affiliates are performing through the platform.

tags.name: Cancellation Policy
tags.description: Manage property cancellation policies. Cancellation policies dictate when and if a traveler is entitled to a full / partial / no refund.

tags.name: Hotelier
tags.description: Hotelier API

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Accounts are direct relationships between property and affiliate. Account relationships are initiated by either affiliate or hotel and allows for hotels to give account specific pricing to affiliates on an individual basis.

tags.name: Segments
tags.description: Major sales channels can be further divided into segments. Segments are non-direct in as far as a hotel distributes inventory to a subset of affiliates and not a single affiliate. Example: Top-level channel 'Affiliates' can be further segmented into 'Influencer' and 'Blogger'.

tags.name: Ota Codes
tags.description: OTA reference code API

tags.name: Guest Room
tags.description: Manage property room types.

tags.name: Promotion Bundle
tags.description: Promotion Bundle API

tags.name: Place
tags.description: Places are points of interest travelers visit in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many sellable places and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Geo-Location
tags.description: Manage property geo-location.

tags.name: Lifestyles
tags.description: Lifestyle reference data API

tags.name: Analytics
tags.description: Create and track the analytics data sets you created and find interesting.

tags.name: Social Networks
tags.description: List all platform-supported social networks.

tags.name: Channel Manager
tags.description: Indicate which channel manager the property is using. This can be done either during property onboarding or using this endpoint. If it is not done during the onboarding phase, the channel manager defaults to `TRAVELIKO` which is the same as no channel manager and rate ownership goes to the platform.

tags.name: Access
tags.description: Control which registered platform users can manage your property.

tags.name: Property
tags.description: Manage your properties

tags.name: Services
tags.description: Manage property amenity, accessibility and security features.

tags.name: Announcement
tags.description: Properties can create date-based announcements for travelers. These announcements are returned in HotelInventoryResponse if the itinerary matches the announcement date.

tags.name: Booking
tags.description: Retrieve bookings and manage cancellations at the property-level.

tags.name: Perks
tags.description: List all platform-supported perks that can be associated with master rates and used as another way to attracts guests.

tags.name: Review
tags.description: Travelers can leave reviews after a booking has taken place. Properties can see these reviews and also respond to them.

tags.name: Attraction
tags.description: Attractions are things travelers visit in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many sellable attractions and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Add-On
tags.description: Add-ons are ancillary inventory that can be added onto a room booking. It can be literally anything; from a tangible to an intangible good. Note that an add-on can also be made mandatory such as an extra water plane ride to your final island destination in the Maldives or an obligatory Christmas dinner.

tags.name: Geo-IP
tags.description: Search for GeoName data.

tags.name: Spa
tags.description: Spas are health establishments travelers can go to to get a massage or similar in and around the property. They can be free, for informational purposes only, or they can be bookable and commissionable. The goal of any property is to create as many bookable spas and become more attractive to potential guests by being able to offer more than their competition.

tags.name: Geo-Name
tags.description: Retrieve supported geo-names based on the [https://geonames.org](https://geonames.org) dataset.

masterRateRoom.title: Guest room

featuredInd.title: Featured
featuredInd.description: Indicates whether this inventory is featured. Use this flag as a way to signify that this inventory is special.

lifestyleType.title: Lifestyle
lifestyleType.description: Indicate the type of lifestyle this inventory should be associated with.

multimedias.title: Multimedia
multimedias.description: List of images / videos of inventory.

geoNameId.title: geoNameId
geoNameId.description: Set this datapoint to control in which city this inventory is located. Defaults to city where property is located.

commissionable.title: Commissionable
commissionable.description: Indicate whether sales channels receive commission for selling this inventory.

proximityCode.title: Proximity code
proximityCode.description: Supported OTA specification `PRX` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Use this property to sort an inventory in a list of activities.

minAgeAppropriateCode.title: Age qualifying code
minAgeAppropriateCode.description: Supported OTA specification `AQC` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

bookable.title: Bookable
bookable.description: Indicates if this inventory can be added to a booking or if it is read-only marketing material only.

active.title: Active
active.description: Modify inventory availability with this flag.

disabilityFeatures.title: Accessibility features
disabilityFeatures.description: Supported OTA specification `PHY` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

securityFeatures.title: Security features
securityFeatures.description: Supported OTA specification `SEC` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

maxOccupancy.description: Maximum number of guest allowed in a room type.

minOccupancy.description: Minimum number of guests allowed in a room type.

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: Defines the number of rooms of this type

beds.title: Beds
beds.description: A room type can have more than one bed configuration.

size.title: Size
size.description: Number of square meters that defines the size of this room type.

maxAdultOccupancy.title: Max adult occupancy
maxAdultOccupancy.description: Maximum number of adults allowed in a room type.

maxChildOccupancy.title: Max child occupancy
maxChildOccupancy.description: Maximum number of children allowed in a room type.

maxRollaways.title: Max rollaways
maxRollaways.description: Maximum number of rollaway beds allowed in this room type.

roomCategory.title: Room category
roomCategory.description: Indicates the category of the room. Typical values would be Moderate, Standard, or Deluxe. Supported OTA specification `SEG` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

floor.title: Floor
floor.description: Floor an which a room is located

roomLocationCode.title: Room location code
roomLocationCode.description: Indicates the location of the room within the hotel structure. Typical values would be "Near Exit","Close to elevator", "Low Floor" or "High Floor". Supported OTA specification `RLT` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomViewCode.title: Room view code
roomViewCode.description: Indicates the view of the room. Typical values would be "Ocean view", "Pool view" or "Garden View". Supported OTA specification `RVT` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

composite.title: Composite
composite.description: Indicates that the room (suite) is a composite of smaller units.

compositeCount.title: Composite count
compositeCount.description: Number of rooms of this room type that makes up a larger unit (composite) such as a two bedroom suite could be comprised of two king rooms plus other room types. A 0 means disabled.

roomClassificationCode.title: Room classification code
roomClassificationCode.description: Specifies the room classification (e.g., cabin, apartment). Supported OTA specification `GRI` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomArchitectureCode.title: Room architecture code
roomArchitectureCode.description: Specifies the architectural style of a room. Supported OTA specification `ARC` code. See [OTA reference data](#operation/showAvailableCodesForCategory)

roomGender.title: Room gender
roomGender.description: Used to request or specify a gender assignment for a room. Note: Typically used by Hosteliers.

applicableStart.title: Applicable start
applicableStart.description: Start month and day or date for which the attraction (e.g. the start of a season) is available. This date property signifies that the inventory is recurring and / or seasonal. If the date is in the past, only day and month will be used to infer seasonality. If the date is a future date, it will be interpreted as a starting date.

applicableEnd.title: Applicable end
applicableEnd.description: End month and day or date for which the attraction (e.g. the start of a season) is available. This date property signifies that the inventory is recurring and / or seasonal. If the date is in the past, only day and month will be used to infer seasonality. If the date is a future date, it will be interpreted as a ending date.

numberOfAdvanceDays.title: Number of advance days
numberOfAdvanceDays.description: You can control the initial itinerary date used to retrieve travel inventory prices. You can do it in one of two ways: 1. Dynamically set the date by indicating how long and how many days in advance (this field), of today's date, you want to display prices for. 2. Set a fixed date to display prices for. Option 1 is the most common. Option 2 is for when you want to create a new customization and apply it to a specific event that occurs on a specific date. If you don't use either of these options, the itinerary will default to today's date with one night stay. ONLY populate this field if you want to control the itinerary date. Also, leave `startDate` and `endDate` empty.

numberOfStayDays.title: Number of stay days
numberOfStayDays.description: You can control the initial itinerary date used to retrieve travel inventory prices. You can do it in one of two ways: 1. Dynamically set the date by indicating how long (this field) and how many days in advance, of today's date, you want to display prices for. 2. Set a fixed date to display prices for. Option 1 is the most common. Option 2 is for when you want to create a new customization and apply it to a specific event that occurs on a specific date. If you don't use either of these options, the itinerary will default to today's date with one night stay. ONLY populate this field if you want to control the itinerary date. Also, leave `startDate` and `endDate` empty.

startDate.title: Start date
startDate.description: Set a fixed itinerary start date. ONLY populate this field if you want to fix the itinerary date. Also, leave `numberOfAdvanceDays` and `numberOfStayDays` empty.

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: Set a fixed itinerary end date ONLY populate this field if you want to fix the itinerary date. Also, leave `numberOfAdvanceDays` and `numberOfStayDays` empty.

roomConfigurations.title: Room configurations
roomConfigurations.description: Control how many adults / children will be staying and how many rooms. Defaults to: One room, two adults.

useDays.title: Use days
useDays.description: if true, we use numberOfAdvanceDays / numberOfStayDays properties - false, we use startDate / endDate

promotionalCodes.description: If you've received special promotional codes from suppliers to give to your audience, you can choose to bake these code directly into the price by entering them here.

packageScore.description: A property's package score is based on general availability and price for all packages and add-ons offered by the property. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

loyaltyScore.title: Loyalty score
loyaltyScore.description: A property's loyalty score is based on calculating how many available rate plans honor loyalty points. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

popularScore.title: Popular score
popularScore.description: A property's popular score is based on calculating number of bookings across room types. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

experienceScore.title: Experience score
experienceScore.description: A property's experience score is based on how calculating how many types of experiences are available and at what price ranges. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

availabilityScore.title: Availability score
availabilityScore.description: A property's availability score is based on general availability of all room types. If most room types are always unavailable, the attractiveness of this property goes down. We use this as our primary benchmark to decide how and when to feature properties. There is no max score; it's there to compare it against other properties.

numberOfAdvanceDays.title: Number of advance days
numberOfAdvanceDays.description: You can control the initial itinerary date used to retrieve travel inventory prices. You can do it in one of two ways: 1. Dynamically set the date by indicating how long and how many days in advance (this field), of today's date, you want to display prices for. 2. Set a fixed date to display prices for. Option 1 is the most common. Option 2 is for when you want to create a new customization and apply it to a specific event that occurs on a specific date. If you don't use either of these options, the itinerary will default to today's date with one night stay. ONLY populate this field if you want to control the itinerary date. Also, leave `startDate` and `endDate` empty.

numberOfStayDays.title: Number of stay days
numberOfStayDays.description: You can control the initial itinerary date used to retrieve travel inventory prices. You can do it in one of two ways: 1. Dynamically set the date by indicating how long (this field) and how many days in advance, of today's date, you want to display prices for. 2. Set a fixed date to display prices for. Option 1 is the most common. Option 2 is for when you want to create a new customization and apply it to a specific event that occurs on a specific date. If you don't use either of these options, the itinerary will default to today's date with one night stay. ONLY populate this field if you want to control the itinerary date. Also, leave `startDate` and `endDate` empty.

startDate.title: Start date
startDate.description: Set a fixed itinerary start date. ONLY populate this field if you want to fix the itinerary date. Also, leave `numberOfAdvanceDays` and `numberOfStayDays` empty.

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: Set a fixed itinerary end date ONLY populate this field if you want to fix the itinerary date. Also, leave `numberOfAdvanceDays` and `numberOfStayDays` empty.

AutoBaseUnitSteps.title: Auto base unit steps
AutoBaseUnitSteps.description: The time-interval steps when `baseUnit` is set either to `fit` or `auto`. The axis will try to divide the active period into the smallest possible units that yield `maxDateGroups` or less discrete intervals.

AxisLine.title: Line
AxisLine.description: The configuration of the axis lines. Also affects the major and minor ticks, but not the grid lines.

AxisTicks.title: Minor ticks
AxisTicks.description: The configuration of the category axis minor ticks.

CategoryAxisCrosshair.title: Crosshair
CategoryAxisCrosshair.description: The configuration options of the crosshair. The crosshair is displayed when the `categoryAxis.crosshair.visible` option is set to `true`.

CategoryAxisNotes.title: Notes
CategoryAxisNotes.description: The configuration of the category axis notes.

CategoryAxisSelect.title: Select
CategoryAxisSelect.description: The selected axis range. If set, the axis selection is enabled. The range is index-based, starting from zero. Categories with indexes in the range (`select.from`, `select.to`) will be selected. That is, the last category in the range will not be included in the selection. If the categories are dates, the range has to be also specified with date values. Selection is only supported if the axis is horizontal.

ChartCategoryAxis.title: Category axis

axisCrossingValue.title: Axis crossing value
axisCrossingValue.description: The category index or the date (for date category axis) at which the first value axis crosses this axis. The category indices or the date (for date category axis) at which the value axes cross the category axis (when set as an array). To denote the far end of the axis, set an index greater than or equal to the Number of categories.

items.title: Axis crossing value
items.description: The category index or the date (for date category axis) at which the first value axis crosses this axis. The category indices or the date (for date category axis) at which the value axes cross the category axis (when set as an array). To denote the far end of the axis, set an index greater than or equal to the Number of categories.

background.title: Background
background.description: The background color of the axis.

baseUnit.title: Base unit
baseUnit.description:
The base time interval for the date axis. The default base unit is automatically determined by the minimum difference between subsequent categories. The supported values are: 

- `fit`
- `milliseconds`
- `seconds`
- `minutes`
- `hours`
- `days`
- `weeks`
- `months`
- `years`
Setting `baseUnit` to `fit` sets such a base unit and `categoryAxis.baseUnitStep` that the total Number of categories does not exceed `categoryAxis.maxDateGroups`. Series data is aggregated for the specified base unit by using the `series.aggregate` function.

baseUnitStep.title: Base unit step
baseUnitStep.description: The step (interval) between the categories in base units. Setting it to `auto` sets the step to such a value that the total Number of categories does not exceed `categoryAxis.maxDateGroups`. The option is ignored if `categoryAxis.baseUnit` is set to `fit`.

categories.title: Categories
categories.description: The category names. The Chart creates a category for every item of the array.

items.title: Categories
items.description: The category names. The Chart creates a category for every item of the array.

color.title: Color
color.description: The color to apply to all axis elements. Accepts a valid CSS color String, including hex and rgb. Can be overridden by `categoryAxis.labels.color` and `categoryAxis.line.color`.

justified.title: Justified
justified.description: If set to `true`, the Chart positions categories and series points on major ticks. This removes the empty space before and after the series. The default value is `false` except for `area`, `verticalArea`, `rangeArea`, and `verticalRangeArea`. The option is ignored if the `series.type` option is set to `bar`, `column`, `boxPlot`, `ohlc`, `candlestick`, or `waterfall`.

max.title: Max
max.description: The last date displayed on a date category axis or the index of the last category displayed on a category axis. By default, the max value is the same as the last category. This is often used in combination with the `categoryAxis.min` and `categoryAxis.roundToBaseUnit` options to set up a fixed date range.

maxDateGroups.title: Max date groups
maxDateGroups.description: The maximum Number of groups (categories) to display when `categoryAxis.baseUnit` is set to `fit` or `categoryAxis.baseUnitStep` is set to `auto`.

maxDivisions.title: Max divisions
maxDivisions.description: The maximum Number of ticks and labels to display. Applicabable for date category axis.

min.title: Min
min.description: The first date which is displayed on a date category axis or the index of the first category whcih is displayed on a category axis. By default, the min value is the same as the first category. This is often used in combination with the `categoryAxis.max` and `categoryAxis.roundToBaseUnit` options to set up a fixed date range.

name.title: Name
name.description: The unique axis name. Used to associate a series with a category axis, which utilizes the `series.categoryAxis` option.

pane.title: Pane
pane.description: The name of the pane in which the category axis has to be rendered. If not set, the axis will be rendered in the first (default) pane.

plotBands.title: Plot bands
plotBands.description: The plot bands of the category axis.

reverse.title: Reverse
reverse.description: If set to `true`, the category axis direction is reversed. By default, categories are listed from left to right and from bottom to top.

roundToBaseUnit.title: Round to base unit
roundToBaseUnit.description: If set to `true`, the Chart rounds the first and last date to the nearest base unit.

startAngle.title: Start angle
startAngle.description: The angle (degrees) of the first category on the axis. Angles increase clockwise with zero to the left. Negative values are acceptable.

type.title: Type
type.description:
The category axis type. The supported values are:

- `category` Discrete category axis.- `date`
 Specialized axis for displaying chronological data.

visible.title: Visible
visible.description: If set to `true`, the Chart displays the category axis. By default, the category axis is visible.

weekStartDay.title: Week start day
weekStartDay.description: The week start day when the `baseUnit` is set to `weeks`.

ChartCategoryAxis.description: The configuration options of the category axis.

ChartCategoryAxisLabels.title: Labels
ChartCategoryAxisLabels.description: The configuration of the axis labels.

ChartCategoryAxisMajorGridLines.title: Major grid lines
ChartCategoryAxisMajorGridLines.description: The configuration of the major grid lines. These are the lines that are an extension of the major ticks through the body of the Chart.

ChartLegend.title: Legend
ChartLegend.description: The configuration options for the chart legend.

ChartSeries.title: Series

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the Chart series which is visible in the legend.

data.title: Data
data.description:
The array of data items which represent the series data.

You can set it to:

- Array of numbers. Supported when the series.type option is set to `area`, `bar`, `column`, `donut`, `pie`, `line`, or `waterfall`.
The Bubble series need arrays of three values—X value, Y value, and Size value—for example, [1, 1, 10]. The Scatter and ScatterLine series need arrays of two values—X value and Y value. The OHLC and Candlestick series need arrays of four values—open, high, low, and close. The RangeBar and RangeArea series need arrays of two values—the from and to value.

items.title: Data
items.description:
The array of data items which represent the series data.

You can set it to:

- Array of numbers. Supported when the series.type option is set to `area`, `bar`, `column`, `donut`, `pie`, `line`, or `waterfall`.
The Bubble series need arrays of three values—X value, Y value, and Size value—for example, [1, 1, 10]. The Scatter and ScatterLine series need arrays of two values—X value and Y value. The OHLC and Candlestick series need arrays of four values—open, high, low, and close. The RangeBar and RangeArea series need arrays of two values—the from and to value.

ChartSeries.description: The configuration of the chart series. The series type is determined by the value of the type field. If a type value is missing, the chart renders the type that is specified in `seriesDefaults`. Some options accept functions as arguments. These arguments are evaluated for each point which is supplied as a parameter. If no value is returned, the chart uses the `theme` or `seriesDefaults` values.

ChartSeriesDefaults.title: Series defaults

type.title: Type
type.description:
The default type of the series.

The supported values are:

- area
- bar
- bubble
- bullet
- candlestick
- column
- donut
- funnel
- line
- ohlc
- pie
- polarArea
- polarLine
- polarScatter
- radarArea
- radarColumn
- radarLine
- rangeArea
- rangeBar
- rangeColumn
- scatter
- scatterLine
- verticalArea
- verticalBullet
- verticalLine
- verticalRangeArea
- waterfall

ChartSeriesDefaults.description: The default options of all series.

ChartTitle.title: Title
ChartTitle.description: The configuration options for the chart title

ChartTooltip.title: Tool tip

visible.title: Visible
visible.description: If set to `true`, the Chart displays the series tooltip. By default, the series tooltip is not displayed.

format.title: Format
format.description:
The format of the labels. Uses the format method of IntlService. The available format placeholders are:

- Area, Bar, Column, Funnel, Line, and Pie {0} - value
- Bubble {0} - x value{1} - y value{2} - size value{3} - category name
- Scatter and scatterLine {0} - x value{1} - y value
- Candlestick and OHLC {0} - open value{1} - high value{2} - low value{3} - close value{4} - category name

ChartTooltip.description: The configuration options of the Chart series tooltips. The tooltip of the Chart series is displayed when the `tooltip.visible` option is set to `true`.

axisCrossingValue.title: Axis crossing value
axisCrossingValue.description:
- (Only for objects) The value at which the category axis crosses this axis.
- (Only for arrays) The value indices at which the category axes cross the value axis.
- (Only for dates) The date at which the category axis crosses this axis.

majorUnit.title: Major unit
majorUnit.description: The interval between major divisions. If `valueAxis.type` is set to `log`, the majorUnit value is used for the base of the logarithm.

ChartValueAxis.description: The configuration options of the value axis.

format.title: Format
format.description: The format for displaying the labels. Uses the format method of IntlService. Contains one placeholder (`{0}`) which represents the category value.

ChartValueAxisLine.title: Line

visible.title: Visible
visible.description: If set to true, the Chart displays the axis lines. By default, the axis lines are visible.

ChartValueAxisLine.description: The configuration of the axis lines. Also affects the major and minor ticks, but not the grid lines.

GridLines.title: Minor grid lines
GridLines.description: The configuration of the minor grid lines. These are the lines that are an extension of the minor ticks through the body of the Chart.

series.title: Series
series.description: The configuration of the chart series. The series type is determined by the value of the type field. If a type value is missing, the chart renders the type that is specified in `seriesDefaults`. Some options accept functions as arguments. These arguments are evaluated for each point which is supplied as a parameter. If no value is returned, the chart uses the `theme` or `seriesDefaults` values.

renderAs.title: Render as
renderAs.description:
Sets the preferred rendering engine. If not supported by the browser, the Chart switches to the first available mode.

The supported values are:

- svg (If available, renders the component as an inline .svg file.)- canvas (If available, renders the component as a canvas element.)

transitions.title: Transitions
transitions.description: If set to `true`, the Chart plays animations when it displays the series. By default, animations are enabled.
